DOC.detailed_description: This study single centre , prospective , feasibility safety study . Consecutively enrol 50 patient . Subjects include adult patient suffer cardiac arrest return spontaneous circulation ( ROSC ) . To qualify , patient must unconscious intubated initial Glasgow Coma Score ( GCS ) < 8 . Intravenous therapeutic hypothermia ( TH ) establish cathlab maintain 24 hour whilst care intensive Care Unit ( ICU ) . IVTM maintain patient 's core temperature target temperature 32-34 degree Celsius . After patient receive 12 hour TH , sedation stop patient comprehensive neurological assessment combine electroencephalogram ( EEG ) , Somatic Sensory Evoked Potential ( SSEP ) neurological biomarkers , Neuron Specific Enolase ( NSE ) S100b . The EEG , SSEP biomarkers review expert neurophysiology core lab off-site . These result review retrospectively , therefore influence medical management patient . Patients clinically stable show adverse neurological sign extubated 12 hour . Patients n't meet early waking criterion reassess every 6 hour extubation . Those patient suitable woken early remain unconscious 24 hour reassess per standard practice unconscious survivor cardiac arrest .
